basics.name: Jiayi Liu
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering in the Department of Mechanical Engineering at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2026.

work.summary: Support students in various aspects of a course; including lecture, recitation, laboratories, office hours, and/or Help Rooms
highlights:
Tutored 46 students, fostering a growth mindset and encouraging persistence through tailored questioning
strategies and video resources.

work.company: UH Manoa Department of Mechanical Engineering

volunteer.organization: Soft Robotics and Intelligent Machines Laboratory (SAIL)
volunteer.summary:
Utilized manufacturing techniques, including FDM and SLA printing, to fabricate numerous actuators, identifying
an optimal fabrication method that improved actuator durability.
â€¢ Conducted image processing and data analysis using Python lib
highlights:
Developed a bio-inspired jellyfish robot, enabling propulsion and grasping in confined underwater environments;
optimized its design to reduce size by 27% for maneuverability.

Conducted image processing and data analysis using Python libraries such as OpenCV, Scripy, and Matplotlib to
graph swimming patterns and calculate movement ranges of fish, contributing to bio-inspired model and robotic
system development.

volunteer.organization: American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) @ UH Manoa
highlights: Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
